name: df-zeta
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3
body: |- wceq(czeta, crio(s0, co(cdif(cc, csn(nat1)), ccncf, cc), wral(s1, cdif(cc, csn(nat1)), wceq(co(co(nat1, cmin, co(nat2, ccxp, co(nat1, cmin, cv(s1)))), cmul, cfv(cv(s0), cv(s1))), csu(s2, cn0, co(csu(s3, co(nat0, cfz, cv(s2)), co(co(co(cneg(nat1), cexp, cv(s3)), cmul, co(cv(s2), cbc, cv(s3))), cmul, co(co(cv(s3), caddc, nat1), ccxp, cv(s1)))), cdiv, co(nat2, cexp, co(cv(s2), caddc, nat1))))))))
comment: Define the Riemann zeta function. This definition uses a series expansion of the alternating zeta function ~~? zetaalt that is convergent everywhere except ` 1 ` , but going from the alternating zeta function to the regular zeta function requires dividing by ` 1 - 2 ^ ( 1 - s ) ` , which has zeroes other than ` 1 ` . To extract the correct value of the zeta function at these points, we extend the divided alternating zeta function by continuity. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Jul-2014.)
